item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, May 14, 2025 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Bus stops here: Shanghai lets riders design their own routes (158 points | 91 comments)
2. Don't use Wise. They can lock your account at any time. We're down $60k (16 points | 3 comments)
3. RPG in a Box (96 points | 9 comments)
4. Type-constrained code generation with language models (183 points | 65 comments)
5. Flattening Rust’s learning curve (202 points | 147 comments)
6. Raycast (YC W20) Is Hiring AI Engineer (Remote, UTC ± 3h) ( | hide)
7. Writing that changed how I think about programming languages (28 points | 4 comments)
8. Branch Privilege Injection: Exploiting branch predictor race conditions (361 points | 139 comments)
9. Replicube: A puzzle game about writing code to create shapes (44 points | 11 comments)
10. Google is building its own DeX: First look at Android's Desktop Mode (289 points | 226 comments)
11. Show HN: HelixDB – Open-source vector-graph database for AI applications (Rust) (157 points | 64 comments)
12. Failed Soviet Venus lander Kosmos 482 crashes to Earth after 53 years in orbit (137 points | 96 comments)
13. Launch HN: Miyagi (YC W25) turns YouTube videos into online, interactive courses (175 points | 98 comments)
14. Build real-time knowledge graph for documents with LLM (122 points | 18 comments)
15. Mipmap selection in too much detail (39 points | 8 comments)
16. Show HN: Mycelium (19 points | 4 comments)
17. EM-LLM: Human-Inspired Episodic Memory for Infinite Context LLMs (45 points | 5 comments)
18. Multiple security issues in GNU Screen (368 points | 219 comments)
19. PDF to Text, a challenging problem (274 points | 154 comments)
20. Ash Framework – Model your domain, derive the rest (4 points | discuss)
21. Airbnb is in midlife crisis mode (132 points | 224 comments)
22. It Awaits Your Experiments (159 points | 58 comments)
23. Garbage collection of object storage at scale (72 points | 9 comments)
24. The world could run on older hardware if software optimization was a priority (662 points | 606 comments)
25. Using obscure graph theory to solve programming languages problems (53 points | 8 comments)
26. A tool to verify estimates, II: a flexible proof assistant (40 points | discuss)
27. A visual history of the safety pin (22 points | 2 comments)
28. OpenTelemetry protocol with Apache Arrow (86 points | 16 comments)
29. I learned Snobol and then wrote a toy Forth (128 points | 33 comments)
30. Fingers wrinkle the same way every time they’re in the water too long (115 points | 44 comments)
